Name: Michaela B
Title: Free and informative, but missing something in terms of customer appreciation
Review: Free entry and plenty of staff around to guide you around the exhibits. We found the acoustics within the building (and mask wearing guide), difficult to hear and understand clearly. An inspirational and amazing man.... interesting exhibits with interactivity BUT for us, being able to travel around at our own pace with a QR code for an audio guide would have given us more satisfaction and the museum a higher score.

Name: SAROJ8585
Title: A JOURNEY TO GANDHIS LIFE
Review: National Gandhi museum contains huge picture gallaries depicting Gandhis life,work and ideals in photographs ,artworks,paintings and his relics.It also contains a well maintain specialized library having nearly 40000 books,magazines,his correspondence,books on world peace and religions

Name: Janet B
Title: Very moving experience
Review: Could have spent all day here. The museum is very informative as is the whole memorial site.  When you follow the final footsteps Mahatma Gandhi took hed on his last journey it is very moving. The atmospher is very respectful and really toucned me.

Name: MamaT23
Title: A walk through his life
Review: A very informative Walkthrough Museum of his entire world. Step by step of his life in  chronological order. Bit shocking seeing his blood stained shawl which he wore  while he was assassinated.

Name: eandeMelbourne
Title: Gandhi Museum
Review: Very comprehensive museum on the life of Gandhi.  Lots of photos and written information. Gives a real feel for the person.

Name: Hadassa
Title: So INSTRUCTIVE, Interesting and calm
Review: From our plural visits to museums in India and beyond, our interest was concerning the kind of public undertaking that museums cultivate, has grown, further Indian museums have splended series but fail to actively bind with their communer. The dweller Council of learning Museum in India & a knob of other museums have merged this approach, lately, however, we have yearned for museums across the country to follow suit, wsorth it!

Name: Tarique S
Title: GLIMPSES OF THE LIFE OF A GREAT SOUL
Review: Gandhi, a man who is revered all over the world for his philosophy of 'Ahimsa' or 'Non Violence'. Man, who taught the world that no matter how tough the battle is, it can still be won by love. He took up no arms, still defeated his opponents. Lived simplest life with some of the greatest philosophical thinking. Man, who eradicated untouchability from our society and left an indelible mark in the history of mankind. Such was Mahatma Gandhi and this humble Museum has tried its best to bring forth some of the glimpses of his life.The Museum is built on two floors, the ground and the first floor. As you enter the main building, you find a larger than life size bust of Mahatma Gandhi to your left and an exhibition hall to your right, where presently the photographs of Gandhi‚Äôs Life in South Africa has been put on show.There is Library on the ground floor which has around 40,000 books in English and other Indian languages, like Urdu, Hindi, Tamil, and Guajarati etc. The collection of this Library have been divided into two sections, viz. ‚ÄòGandhiana (including freedom movement) and ‚ÄòGeneral‚Äô. The ‚ÄòGandhiana‚Äô section includes books, journals and documents by Gandhiji, on Gandhiji, his philosophy, ideology and those on the history of the Indian Freedom Movement from 1857 to 1947. The ‚ÄòGeneral‚Äô section includes books, journals and documents on subjects other than those covered under the ‚ÄòGandhiana‚Äô. No membership fee is required for consulting books. The access to library is free for all.As you climb the stairs to reach the first floor you will come across an abstract by Nobel Laureate, great writer and a poet, Rabindranath Tagore, which he wrote on Gandhiji. On the first floor lies the ‚ÄòCharkha Museum‚Äô. Charkha or ‚ÄòSpinning wheel‚Äô, became a symbol of freedom movement and also played a pivotal role in ‚ÄòSwaraj‚Äô movement. It represented a desire to achieve self-dependency, self-responsibility, self-respect and self-realisation.‚ÄòCommemorative Gallery‚Äô on the first floor exhibits many of the belongings of Gandhiji and in ‚ÄòMartyrdom Museum‚Äô, the blood stained cloth of Gandhiji has been displayed. It was the same cloths that Gandhiji was wearing when he was assassinated by Nathuram Godse.There are few things in the museum which are indeed amazing and adds extra charm to it. Like the recreated heartbeats of Gandhiji which can be seen in the form of ECG and can also be heard on headphone. One can listen to the original voice of Gandhiji on a handset of telephone. The ‚ÄúWalking Stick‚Äù of Gandhiji is also on display. It is the same ‚Äúwalking Stick‚Äù which Gandhiji used during the great ‚ÄúDandi March‚Äù in 1930. Two teeth of Gandhiji extracted by Dr Barretto at Nagpur has also been kept on display at this museum.This museum doesn‚Äôt just displays objects but also teaches the much needed philosophy for the present time. I would definitely recommend this museum to people of age groups.Important Infos:1. Free Parking is available inside the main campus of the Museum.2. The Museum and the Library are open from Tuesday to Sunday between 10 am to 5:30 pm.3. There is a small souvenir shop in the main building where you can purchase show pieces and books as well.4. A Tea/Coffee stall is also available near the Parking bay.5. Photography is allowed inside the main building.6. Public Convenience is also available inside the main building.

Name: macedonboy
Title: Museum dedicated to the great Gandhi
Review: The National Gandhi Museum and Library as the name suggests is both a museum and a library, the former dedicated to the great father of the nation of India, the latter mostly a library, but with an emphasis on Gandhi.The museum chronicles the life and times of Gandhi through exhibits, photographs and paintings. If you want to know about the achievements of the great many, this museum is one of the best places to do that.

Name: Sunil
Title: Gandhi museum
Review: The great place to witness the Gandhi history. The place is well maintained by Delhi authorities and quite informative

Name: Ellemay üçπüê†üê≥
Title: Interesting.
Review: The National Gandhi Museum showcases the life of Mahatma Gandhi. It has a large collection of original books, journals, photographs, materials & papers connected to Gandhi. It's a fascinating journey into the life of a very special person before the assassination in January 1948.

Name: Mavis57
Title: A moving tribute to Gandhi's life
Review: Well worth a visit - there is a lot to read and take in inside the house, so give yourself plenty of time. The calm greenery of the gardens helps to alleviate the solemnity of the story.

Name: Arne Birkeland
Title: Informative and interesting
Review: A good place to visit to become more informed about Gandhi. Especially the doll expo of different parts of his life were interesting and informative for kids

Name: Orchid Z
Title: Ghandi Smirti - where Mahatma Gandhi was assassinated
Review: This is the house where Mahatma Gandhi lived just before he was assassinated in the garden just behind the house.  Ghandi lived, taught and peacefully fought for India's independence from the British.  He is known by many as the "Father of India".

Name: Kris M
Title: My new hero
Review: This is a must in Delhi to understand what an amazing man Gandhi was and what he did for India and South Africa.the power of peaceful and non participation to achieve many thi gs for the poor. You also understand his philosophy of life, which is deeply rooted in Indian culture. Spend time here.

Name: JustC28
Title: Informative and sobering
Review: Awesome place to visit. Very well presented and hugely informative. Set aside a good amount of time as there is plenty to read about and take in. Great place to prove that peaceful protest can be effective and intolerance and violence doesn't have to be precursor to change. Free to visit, you don't need a guide.

Name: Wendy w
Title: A national Museum
Review: This house is quite small for large bus loads of people to go through. Situated in a quiet neighbourhood I actually feel sorry for the people living around here to have so many bus loads of people invading their street. Mahatma Gandhi is very well respected by Indians hence this museum showing different photos & memorabilia of his life. Because of the amount of people climbing up 3 levels of this house combined with extreme heat I didn‚Äôt really enjoy this museum.

Name: Gala2812
Title: The good learning experience
Review: Nice museum in the quite governmental quarters. The area is well-maintained and neat. The museum tells about Mahatma Ghandi, his life and beliefs. There's an intercative part on the second floor that would be a fun place to go, especially for kids. It shows Ghandi's ideas in a simple but impressive manner as well as gives introduction to the cultural background. On the first floor there's a hall to watch a movie about his life. The house is pretty big but Ghandi was said to occupy just one room and you can see his everyday life was very simple. The garden around includes some nice landscapes and the spot where he was shot during the public meditation by one of his former friends. And yes, he's got to say the words of forgiveness to the shooter. I would say its a great place to visit in Delhi to get closer to the modern history India and life of one of the most outstanding humanists of the world.

Name: Bruce & Angela H
Title: In the Style of Gandhi Himself
Review: This museum is free to go through and very simple in it's presentation which I liked. Lots of dedications by world leaders and a mountain of photos and chronological descriptions of his life and struggles. I learned a lot and am glad we took the time to visit. You don't need a guide for this.

Name: Nicola T
Title: Excellent source of exhibits on Muhatma Gandhi
Review: Short visit here whilst on a tour. Beautifully kept gardens and exhibits. All translated into English. Some areas outside require shoes to be removed. You can take photography here. Was 40 degrees centigrade on our visit in early April so welcomed a chance to sit down and watch a film about Gandhi in a cool area inside. There are original relics, books, photographs and journals and audio visual assistance if required. Was a very calm and respectful place.

Name: TobyMontreal_Canada
Title: Very Rewarding Visit
Review: We agree with others that said that this free museum could be updated....BUT we still found it very inspiring and moving, with interesting photographs and artefacts.   We were there for a while and yet felt we would have liked to have had more free time to see this museum....by the way free admission!

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Needs improvement to get a top billing
Review: This is a National Museum on Gandhiji. But this is not the best one. I shall rate many other museums definitely better than this one. This is also informative but not very well kept. I hope Authorities improve it by renovation.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: Jodi R
Title: Inspiring
Review: This museum is everything about Mahatma Gandhi.  Entry is free and there are some amazing artefacts and photographs sharing the history of his life and work.  Certainly worth a visit.

Name: PipPaul W
Title: Very disappointing
Review: For a 'National Gandhi Museum ' this was very disappointing. Tired displays, faded photos and a few badly displayed artifacts.There are better places in Delhi to find out about Gandhi

Name: sunrise99
Title: National Gandhi Museum Visit
Review: I found this museum very interesting finding out about Gandhi‚Äôs life, causes and politics.Allow a few hours as there is lots to look at and read about.I wouldn‚Äôt be put off by the exterior of the museum. Once inside there is lots to take in. Displays are set out clearly written in Hindi and English. Spinning history and politics found  in ‚ÄòThe Spinning Gallery‚Äô, ‚ÄòCharka‚Äô, caught my attention. Gandhi himself spun and the wheel represented independence and self-sufficiency.

Name: StratosLFC
Title: Worth to visit
Review: A must visit place if you want to learn some things about ‚ÄúGandhi's lifeIntersting things inside with all of his past.

Name: DonnamjCan
Title: Interesting
Review: Popped in here for a 1 hour visit and was able to see the highlights. There is a lot to see if you are interested in the life and teachings of Gandhi and want to see pictures etc of his childhood, some of his talks, where he last walked, where he was assassinated. If you want to take the time to read everything than you need a couple of hours. For us an hour was more than enough as the pictures are quite repetitive. There is a fairly large states re on site that sells cloth (clothing etc). This is a typical museum site and has a lot to read and many pictures to look at. Not great for young kids.

Name: durham05
Title: Gandhi as he was
Review: Was rather off the beaten track to get to this museum but well worth the effort. A huge display of items associated with Gandhi, from his personal everyday objects to the clothes in which he as assassinated. Highly recommended.

Name: cristoph2010
Title: Mahatma Gandhi
Review: This museum showcases the life of Mahatma Gandhi, a definite giant in India's political and social history.  You can see actual artifacts used by Gandhi and replicas.  Lots of quotes and sayings by the man himself.  So you'll get a glimpse into his philosophy and learn about what motivated him.  It's free so you can't get any better than that when you're in Delhi.

Name: jmodi1981
Title: Nice Museum
Review: It was really a nice experience to see this Museum, we really need 4 to 6 hours to cover this place as it has lot of things to visit. However, we couldn't able to spent more time due to other places which were in the plan.

Name: Rosemary L
Title: Life of Ghandi
Review: This is a beautiful museum in New Delhi, India about the life of Mahatma Ghandi.  It was very interesting to understand his life, where he came from and his philosophies. I saw Indian garments for sale as well, his traditional clothing.I would combine this with a visit to his tomb, also in Delhi, where people come every day to pay respects.

Name: Mark M
Title: Nice Museum
Review: Very interesting museum where an hour would do to visit Located in a really exclusive part of town and free to visit Worth a look if your near by

Name: Sharon C
Title: worth the visit
Review: This is not just a museum for adults but also children can interact with displays and learn alot about an incredible man.Thoroughly enjoyed my time here learning more about history.

Name: Diana D
Title: Humble Man
Review: To actually see how Gandhi lived and where he died was an eye opener for me. It offered me an Asian taste of history

Name: nikkiprincess005
Title: Life of Gandhiji
Review: Almost all the elements and life of Gandhiji covered in this National museum of Gandhiji and called known very well around the whole world.

Name: Simmurani
Title: Historic
Review: Not boring as it basically focuses on the life of father of the nation- Bapu, showcasing his artifacts and letters and his timeline of achievements

Name: PushExplore
Title: Unique Experience
Review: The trip to the National Gandhi Museum was a unique experience for us. The place provides a sense of calmness. The items on display were truly unique.

Name: Sunil K
Title: Gandhi's life!
Review: If you would like to learn about the life of  Mahatama Gandhi you may visit this place. Quite beautiful place. Many things belonging to Gandhi are kept here.

Name: Tim L
Title: Old school museum
Review: If you are onto Gandhi and his work it is a must see. A timeline of photos and quotes of his work. Fantastic stories and structure. It does seem as if the museum is stuck in the 1950's though. Good air conditioning in most rooms which is appreciated. I loved it! Driver FYI - We used Raj from Sheetal Tours - he was fantastic, spoke great English and we felt extremely safe. My tip: Don't use the hotel driver, I would suggest Raj. His number  +91 9810776968

Name: Tammy2124
Title: Wonderful memorial
Review: If you have the time it is worth a visit. Very informative museum on the life and work of Gandhi. Loved all the quotes on various topics and issues spread throughout the museum.

Name: Lovegoodfoodgoodwine
Title: All life of Mr Gandhi
Review: Great museum tracing the very last years of Gandhi, showing everything in detail, such as his last clothes, his glasses and even his two last teeths.. Very instructive in general.

Name: Saurav K
Title: Well Maintained Museum
Review: Here You will see some Historical Things Which is best to know.And You can watch Short Stories About Mahatma Gandhi.However There Is no any entry fee for this museum.

Name: Gdaynamaste
Title: Peaceful, moving tribute to inspirational man.
Review: A peaceful small old style museum. Have visited many times with overseas visitors and they always leave having had ‚Äú a moment‚Äù. The respectful and moving atmosphere in the ‚ÄúMartyrdom Gallery‚Äù is felt by many.Yesterday we were able to leisurely walk around the building taking our time to observe a vast collection of historical photos and objects. The book collection on Mahatma Gandhi is also worth a look.Shady garden, good parking on premises and a kiosk.

Name: Fazul M
Title: Life of a Man
Review: I have come across the great man named Gandhiji where the term Ji denotes respect. Most of my reading largely centred around the independence of India. The museum was really an eye opener as his single mindedness actually begun in South Africa and later on his return to India that moved up multiple notches until the day he died; shot by a fundamentalist. The museum takes you back to his formative years, his way of life, legacy and most of all what he stood for. Most impressive that makes us look like less than mere mortals.

Name: nik_0107
Title: Peaceful and Well Maintined
Review: Great museum to see some of the historical photos and belongings of Mahatma Gandhi. There is no fees to enter the museum and they also show are short video on Mahatma Gandhi.

Name: Charles H
Title: Still moved by the loss of a great spiritual leader
Review: Just over 70 years ago, I recall sheer desolation in the normally busy streets. Visiting the site where Gandhi spent the last 144 days of his life and to read his sayings alongside historical photos was the most moving experience of our tour of Delhi and Shimla. At this beautifully maintained and such peaceful centre, we spent two hours studying the simple belongings of a humble leader and watched a truly moving video recalling the manner of his passing on 30th January 1948, before retracing his last steps in the garden. Highly recommended place to visit when in New Delhi.

Name: Kathleen M
Title: Very Moving To Be There
Review: It is quite moving to follow the steps he took to his final moment. Beautiful, well tended grounds and buildings. Free to public. I'm very glad I went. Also a wonderful shop that benefits underprivileged artisans.

Name: Kelly K
Title: Peaceful and well kept park
Review: It was a lovely way to spend an hour with quite a walk between plaques and statues. Not much shade if you have little ones

Name: 46susan46
Title: great interesting mueum
Review: we arrived early to beat the heat and had plenty of time to appreciate this fab museum and get to have a proper look at all the displays

Name: Peter F
Title: Informative
Review: This venue is worthwhile from a historical and informative point of view. Well worth a visit and very pleasant to walk around.

Name: Ted B
Title: Good reminder of Gandhi's life
Review: A good place with many interesting displays including his sandals, the staff he used on his march to the sea, and the clothes he was wearing when he was assassinated.  Worth a visit.

Name: DotM53
Title: Amazingly moving, quiet and reflective museum
Review: I could easily have spent all day at this museum.  We were lucky to go on a really quiet day at the museum.  The impact of seeing where Gandhi spent his last days and where he was killed is quite profound and moving.The displays in the museum of his life and history and many, many of his thoughtful and provocative quotes are quite spellbinding.I did not expect to be so affected by our visit, so I was quite blown away.  We have traveled in many countries and been to countless museums, this is one of my absolute favorites.

Name: cisco289
Title: Learn About this Very Special Man
Review: A trip without finding out about Gandhi is like visiting the U.S. and not learning about Lincoln (or even Disney Land). He was so very brave and focused----and, of course, nonviolent. The museum offers much about his life, journeys, trials & tribulations. He is a great example of the kind of human I wish I was strong enough to even approximate.

Name: John S
Title: Must See
Review: Walked here from my hotel and had a great time reading about Gandhi and his live and writings.  Very thought provoking and would like to read more in the future.  Easily walk around the complete and readings on the walls.  2 hrs max.

Name: prkota05
Title: Mahatma Gandhi museum
Review: Belonging achievements and history of Mahatma Gandhi is shown here so nice place and it's tribute to Gandhi ji

Name: goodguyjas
Title: Small museum celebrating a legendary human being
Review: This is not a big place to visit but I was surprised to find it seemed to be free when I was there. I don‚Äôt think I jumped any queue or missed something but was ushered through the gates like others by a uniform guard and had the usual security check. The main building was very busy when I was there and there is a lot to read and look at. The garden area was pleasant enough but there was only the gift shop after. This was not on my main tour so relied on my own day trip using the Tuk Tuk taxi. Great fun and pretty cheap if you can do a deal with a drive for a number of hours.

Name: _neil_ackerman1950
Title: Historical event that made a Nation
Review: Seeing where Gandhi spent the last fourteen days of his life was a highlight at the start of an Incredible Trip. The humbleness of this man and the history showing how he reached there was humbling in its own way to the visitor. Very well laid out and serene in a city of noise. Very enjoyable.

Name: AussieTravellers555
Title: Fitting tribute to a great man
Review: Very informative and well kept museum. It is a fitting tribute to a very inspirational man. A reminder of who he was and what he achieved in his lifetime. Well worth the visit.

Name: Alice V
Title: A must-see!
Review: This small museum houses a weath of information about Gandhi in a variety of formats -- letters, histograms, photos, paintings, and physical objects.  While not modern, and far from the "slick" presentations of many newer museums, the National Gandhi is nonetheless one of the most effective sources of information and insight into one of the world's most remarkable men.

Name: RWHinze
Title: A lot of history here
Review: This is where Gandhi spent his last hours his foot steps are raised showing his path up to the assassin.  His home is what one would expect from Gandhi, simple modest, and open.  There is much history all around the grounds showing Gandhi's life and accomplishments.

Name: mandypage2015
Title: A most see
Review: Gandhi is such a part of modern India - and this museum has so many nice spots. The animated show of his last day with the background raga is very special. The path of his footsteps is very moving.

Name: Arlene L
Title: Very interesting and inspiring
Review: Going to the Ghandi Museum was one of my goals while in New Delhi and it didn't disappoint. I ended up spending about 3 hours there (I'm one of those people who likes to read all the wall text at a museum). There is so much to learn about this inspiring man and I left saddened about his ultimate assassination but uplifted by his amazing outlook on life and how he actually walked the walk instead of just talking the talk. I found the statues and the replica of one of his ashrams in the garden equally compelling.

Name: Sumitkumar_13
Title: Learning experience
Review: National Gandhi Museum provides a great learning experience on Gandhian thoughts. Lot of historic memoirs are available here

Name: Kiri G
Title: Worth a visit
Review: It's always interesting to see parts of history, nothing out of the ordinary but worth a visit while in Delhi

Name: Ali G
Title: loved the place
Review: loved the place.historical and beautiful.have been there a couple of times and would love to go once more

Name: Gretton
Title: Quite interesting
Review: Only visited as it was free and next to our hotel this place was quite interesting if Gandhi rocks your world ,Loved the grounds

Name: SCORPYO1952
Title: A must-see!
Review: Gandhi...the father of the nation! No visit to India is complete unless you visit this museum, where Gandhi took his last steps before his assassination. Very inspirational!

Name: Jack B
Title: Gandhi
Review: Very interesting museum and made you realise the sacrifices Gandhi made to achieve his dream for India.

Name: travelerraghu
Title: Things used by Gandhiji is found here
Review: Gandhi memorial Museum is situated opposite to Raj Ghat. Personal belongings of Gandhiji is kept in display. Those who wants to collect the memories and details of his life can find it very informative and knowledge gaining.

Name: flowergirl58
Title: fantastic museum
Review: dedicate some time to go here but well worth it.It has the history of India laid out chronologically in a multitude of rooms and is fascinating with costumes,jewellery and artifacts going back BC

Name: dave w
Title: a sacred place
Review: everyone knows Ghandi. so this place is like a pilgrimmage. i found it to be a very sacred place to visit. and to see all the history.

Name: Angela M
Title: If you are visiting Delhi, you should come here
Review: Worth coming here to see the shrine dedicated to Gandhi, just a word of caution - take a cover up/scarf if visiting late afternoon/early afternoon as the mosquitos seemed to come out in full force!

Name: cabell2014
Title: Trip of Delights
Review: This can get confusing.  There are a few places Gandhi is billeted.  His resting place is across the street and his residence is elsewhere.  This is on older building dedicated to his work and has the March Statue and model of the house he lived in out back.  There is a lot of information of his work and life here.  It's a great building in itself.  No fee and they wouldn't take a donation ( many places wouldn't). 1 hr is probably enough time. Very emotional to visit.

Name: Dan C
Title: Must Visit
Review: The National Gandhi Museum is a must see in Delhi. The grounds exude peace, and is a remarkable show of affection for the man who had a great impact in the liberation of modern India. The museum with his personal effects, and final steps to the site of his assassination are extremely powerful.Not to be missed.

Name: PerryWorCapPar
Title: Alace of pilgrimage
Review: A very moving memorial to a great man.  Perhaps the best bist is whn you see his bed  and a collection of his personal possessions at the time of his death.  A Delhi highlight

Name: mummybear-Stoke
Title: Very upsetting
Review: I had not realised Gandhi had been shot by a fellow Hindu I had always assumed wrongly that it was a Muslim.  The museum is very well laid out and if you don't have time to go all around it then please find time for the garden it is really beautiful.

Name: W4lking
Title: Well worth a visit
Review: Gandhi's story is inspiring and this museum represents his life and workin a very compelling way. I would definitely recommend a visit

Name: cruiser54
Title: The Life of Mahatma Gandhi
Review: A place where Mr Gandhi's epic life ended on Jan 30, 1948.  There are many artifacts to see at the museum & a Peace bell & Gong outside.

Name: AndyMcGonegal
Title: Wonderful Place Celebrating a Wonderful Man
Review: I spent two hours here drinking in everything Gandhi. I always knew him to have been a great man, but digesting the simple, but powerful, exhibition of his thoughts and deeds was a truly moving experience that reinforced many beliefs that I hold dear. Sadly, modern day society is distinctly at odds with the enlightened teachings of Gandhi.Perhaps the best investment of time that I've ever made.

Name: Aman K
Title: Must Visit Museum
Review: National gandhi museum is a must visit place. To know many things related to Gandhiji, it is necessary to go here. There are no fees.

Name: Mary Beth F
Title: the interesting story of Gandhi
Review: if your interested in history then this should be on your list of places to visit, it explains the life and death of Gandhi

Name: Brian M
Title: Worth visiting
Review: This museum gives a very good description of Gandhi's life and work. Free in so really no reason why you shouldn't go

Name: JKE255103
Title: Worth a visit
Review: The entry is free. There‚Äôs so much information about the national hero of India. His life, his fight, his philosophy, his assasination...

Name: Littlelizamay
Title: A must!
Review: Wonderfully evocative of a man and his time - so moving. A history, so beautifully told.Go & visit it soon!!

Name: TAMAN1951
Title: Nice collection
Review: A number of Ghandi artifacts on display. A fitting tribute to s remarkable man. Very interesting to appreciate the story and impact on a country of one mans life. You will not be disappointed.

Name: Anabel-2013
Title: Important Monument to a Remarkable Individual
Review: Gandhi and this museum deserves great attention.  The presentations are comprehensive and the grounds are lovely.  They offer a documentary that covers Gandhi's first steps to his last. It is important that we remember the parsimonious words of Gandhi and hi contribution to humanity.  This museum is the house where Gandhi spent his last nights and the place where he was assassinated.

Name: AVNI
Title: Visit once
Review: Must visit this place with kids. You will feel a touch of history. If you hold that sort of interest.

Name: robert b
Title: The history of his life story is truly amazing,what a truly lovely man.
Review: Very interesting museum,easy walking for people of all ages and beautiful surrounds.A good driver will find it easily,don't try and find it on your own.

Name: Geoff F
Title: Wonderful. One of the best museums
Review: In may cities, there are places that are essential. The Gandhi Museum is one. It is not large, but clearly lays out the main elements of the man and his life and can take at least two hours to follow completely.What comes across is the beautiful serenity and simplicity of one of the great men of the late 19th and first half of the 20th century in complex situations. He saw through the political chicanery and just said what was right and just. He may have had some impractical ideas, but the beauty of the man shines clearly through the whole of the museum. It can reduce grown men and women to tears.

Name: Kumar S
Title: Gandhi Museum
Review: Situated opposite Raj Ghat, a great deal can be learned about Mahatma Gandhi. Spend a couple of hours, and read description about every picture, it‚Äôs quite interesting.

Name: jonesharma29
Title: National gandhi museum
Review: National gandhi museum is best place to walk in history.here many monument from thier timeline era kept nicely so easy to get know about different era history.

Name: Mohamed Al Rimawi
Title: Amazing man life
Review: It contains almost everything about mahatma Gandhi life house tools pics books and even clothes .. small shop for books and souvenirs

Name: gentbrugg
Title: Opposite to Raj Ghat
Review: Gandhi memorial Museum is located opposite to Raj Ghat ‚Äì the place where first he and then his daughter and grandsons were cremated. The Museum is small. Personal belongings of Gandhi ‚Äì up to one of the bullets that killed him, his dhoti, in which it hit, his canes, urn with his ashes, and the rest ‚Äì occupies in the collection a relatively little space compared to magazines and books promoting the teachings of Gandhi and talking about his life. There are audio-visual materials ‚Äì even a film about his life which is shown to visitors at certain times.

Name: phel_the_fairy
Title: Easy to find
Review: There are lots of interesting photos and I really enjoyed wandering around, reading all the stories about this fascinating man. It's a little dated but worth a visit. I spent a good 2 hours there reading all the photo descriptions etc.It's easy to find- take the Metro to Delhi Gate, take exit 4 and turn right out of the station, then follow the road to the right. It's about 5 mins walk on the right, past the stadium. There is a big blue sign outside.

Name: Creadivs
Title: History on display with hardly any visitors
Review: Was surprised to see a public place with only 2 families as visitor on a Sunday. The place offers rich remembrances of history. Covers all the aspects of Gandhiji's life.The maintenance of the place is below average. Doesn't charge anything as entry/ parking fees.Everyone should visit there once to know and learn more about such a prominent part of our history - Gandhiji.

Name: Mehdi_Farrokh
Title: Leader of a Nation
Review: There are lots of stories about this person. A man who had leadership of a nation with variety of religions. You will see his belongs, some pictures and sentences of him here. It's good to know India from this point. Place is OK but do not expect a huge or extraordinary time there if you are not interested in history.

Name: justinthebyrner
Title: An amazing life of an amazing man
Review: I really enjoyed rediscovering the life of Gandhi. This museum has an amazing collection on the life and history of this great man. Worthwhile visiting if in New Delhi.

Name: Russ1470
Title: Calm
Review: This is a calm and peaceful place to visit where you can find out more about the man. The museum is interesting.

Name: Kirsty C
Title: Amazing - to see the man rather than the myth
Review: Everyone's seen "Gandhi". Everyone knows about "the father of the nation". But do they? This is a great museum to visit, to see Gandhi's few belongings, plus letters and a lot of background to understand what made him into the figure he became.

Name: bradfam2017
Title: Must see
Review: Lovely building great display of his work and understanding of what he stood for. Peaceful although very hot in the building which is a shame as lots to see and read.

Name: Amy D
Title: To know more about father of nation
Review: Located Opposite Raj Ghat, Ring Road, Delhi. one can reach there by cab , car or auto. timing is  10.00am To 5:30 pm . calm & peaceful place .museum  Dedicated to the Father of the Nation, the museum contains some of his personal belongings, like teeths , his spectacles , pictures , documents,book , journels  . There are five pavilions , it also has a  sculpture, photographs and paintings of Gandhi , his movements and the history . and important monday is close .
